CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 2, 1968, pg. 13 reads: "Steel City Golfers - Pittsburgh's newest sports organization, the Steel City Golf Club, will make its social bow at a gala "Sweater Ball" on Sunday, March 24, in the ballroom of the Hilton Hotel. Starting at 7:30, there will be a battle of music between two popular bands, the Bobby Jones Organ group and The Elegants.  Prizes will be awarded for the most attractive sweater worn by a woman and man.  Members of the club are pictured from left: William Browne, Bob Lane, "Boots" Parker, "Sir Walter" Christian, Bobby Jones, Jimmy Dyer and Walt Mangham. (Harris Photo)image of Bobby Jones not in negative, pasted in image published by Pittsburgh Courier.
TitMainTitle: Six members of the Steel City Golf Club, from left: William Browne, Bob Lane, "Boots" Parker, John "Sir Walter" Christian, Jimmy Dyer, and Walt Mangham, gathered behind speaker cabinet in interior with fireplace
